sen.j: 園部町（そのべちょう）は、2005年12月31日まで京都府の中央部に存在した地方公共団体で、園部城の城下町である。
sen.e: Sonobe-cho is a municipality which existed in the central part of Kyoto Prefecture until December 31, 2005, and is a castle town of Sonobe-jo Castle.
Sonobe-cho is a municipality which existed in the central part of Kyoto Prefecture until December 31, 2005, and is a castle town of Sonobe-jo Castle.
Sonobe-cho is a municipality which existed in the central part of Kyoto Prefecture until December 31, 2005, and is a castle town of Sonobe-jo Castle.

sen.j: 2006年1月1日に周辺4町が合併して南丹市となり、地方公共団体としての園部町は歴史の幕を閉じた。
sen.e: Nantan City was formed through the merger between Sonobe-cho and surrounding four towns on January 1, 2006, and the history of Sonobe-cho as a municipality has ended.
Nantan City was formed through the merger between Sonobe-cho and the surrounding four towns on January 1, 2006, bringing a close to the history of Sonobe-cho as a municipality.
Nantan City was formed through the merger between Sonobe-cho and the surrounding four towns on January 1, 2006, bringing a close to the history of Sonobe-cho as a municipality.

sen.j: 現在は南丹市の行政区の地名として残されている。
sen.e: At present, Sonobe-cho only exists as a place name of administrative district.
At present, Sonobe-cho only exists as the name of an administrative district.
At present, Sonobe-cho only exists as the name of an administrative district of Nantan City.
sen.cmt: 南丹市 を追加しました。

sen.j: 胎金寺山（たいこんじやま）
桂川 (淀川水系)（かつらがわ）：京都市左京区に発する淀川水系の河川。
sen.e: Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System): River under the Yodo-gawa River System which starts from Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System): River under the Yodo-gawa River System which starts from Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system): River under the Yodo-gawa River system which starts from Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
sen.cmt: system 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 亀岡市では大堰川（おおいがわ）、嵐山にかけては保津川（ほづがわ）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is called Oi-gawa River in Kameoka City, and Hozu-gawa River in the area around Arashiyama.
It is called Oi-gawa River in Kameoka City, and Hozu-gawa River in the area around Arashiyama.
It is called Oi-gawa River in Kameoka City, and Hozu-gawa River in the area around Arashiyama.

sen.j: 園部川（そのべがわ）：園部町の深山に発し、るり渓を形成して桂川 (淀川水系)に合流する。
sen.e: Sonobe-gawa River: River which starts from Miyama in Sonobe-cho, forms the Rurikei River Valley, and meets the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System)
Sonobe-gawa River: River which starts from Miyama in Sonobe-cho, forms the Rurikei River Valley, and meets the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System)
Sonobe-gawa River: River which starts from Miyama in Sonobe-cho, forms the Rurikei River Valley, and meets the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system)
sen.cmt: system 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 本梅川（ほんめがわ）：亀岡市に発して園部川に合流する。
sen.e: Honme-gawa River: River which starts in Kameoka City, and meets the Sonobe-gawa River
Honme-gawa River: River which starts in Kameoka City, and meets the Sonobe-gawa River
Honme-gawa River: River which starts in Kameoka City, and meets the Sonobe-gawa River

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)末期の園部城に荒木氏綱という土豪がおり、明智光秀に対抗したと言う。
sen.e: It is said that a local clan named Ujitsuna ARAKI existed in the Sonobe-jo Castle during the late Sengokou period (period of warring states), and resisted against Mitsuhide AKECHI.
It is said that a local clan named Ujitsuna ARAKI existed in the Sonobe-jo Castle during the late Sengokou period (period of warring states), and resisted against Mitsuhide AKECHI.
It is said that a local clan named Ujitsuna ARAKI existed in the Sonobe-jo Castle during the late Sengokou period (period of warring states) (Japan), and resisted against Mitsuhide AKECHI.

sen.j: しかし本格的な園部の開発は1619年の小出氏園部入封から始まる。
sen.e: However, the full-fledged development of Sonobe started when the Koide clan was transferred to Sonobe in 1619.
However, full-fledged development of Sonobe started when the Koide clan was transferred to Sonobe in 1619.
However, full-fledged development of Sonobe started when the Koide clan was transferred to Sonobe in 1619.

sen.e: Town mayor: Kazumi NONAKA (younger blood brother of Hiromu NONAKA)

sen.j: 船井郡：京丹波町、日吉町 (京都府)、八木町
sen.e: Funai-gun: Kyotanba-cho, Hiyoshi-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) and Yagi-cho

sen.j: 京都縦貫自動車道あるいは国道9号での自動車交通が中心、京阪京都交通バスが亀岡を通って京都市内まで走っている。
sen.e: The major means of transportation is vehicles using the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway or Route 9, and Keihan Kyoto Kotsu provides bus service operating to the downtown of Kyoto City through Kameoka.
The major means of transportation is vehicles using the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway or Route 9, and Keihan Kyoto Kotsu provides bus service operating to downtown Kyoto City through Kameoka.

sen.j: るり渓温泉（国民保養温泉地は、るり渓高原温泉という源泉の名前）
sen.e: Rurikei Onsen (Spa of Rurikei; listed in the national health hot springs under the name of Rurikei River Valley Highland Hot Spring which means a name of springhead)

sen.j: 道の駅「道の駅京都新光悦村」が平成15年7月17日オープン
sen.e: Michi-no-eki Rest Area, 'Kyoto Shinkoetsu-mura,' opened on July 17, 2003.

sen.j: 国道9号線、丹波町への峠は観音峠。
sen.e: A pass on Route 9 toward Tanba-cho is Kannon-toge (Kannon Pass).
The pass on Route 9 toward Tanba-cho is Kannon-toge (Kannon Pass).
The pass on Route 9 toward Tanba-cho is Kannon-toge Mountain Pass.
sen.cmt: Kannon-toge Mountain Pass としました。

sen.j: 国道372号線篠山市への峠は天引峠（あまびきとうげ）トンネル開通。
sen.e: For the pass on Route 372 toward Sasayama City, the Amabiki-toge (Amabiki Pass) tunnel was completed.
The Amabiki-toge (Amabiki Pass) tunnel was created on Route 372 toward Sasayama Cit.
The Amabiki-toge Mountain Pass tunnel was created on National Route 372 toward Sasayama City.
sen.cmt: Amabiki-toge Mountain Pass, City としました。

sen.e: Both passes are hard to go beyond.
Both passes are hard to go through.
Both passes are hard to go through.

sen.j: 観音峠は京都縦貫道でバイパス出来る。
sen.e: The Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway makes it possible to bypass Kannon-toge.
